title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: Takes longer to load than on Windows, but once it gets in game it performs very well. Alt-tabbing crashes the game.

title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: The game runs and is playable, but crashes regularly

title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes:
Can run game with some visual artifacts: shimmering on edges of some meshes, and small occasional flashes of light. Graphical issues are definitely not a deal breaker.

Hower, game crashes reproducibly in the Lonesome Road DLC as you leave the Hopeville Missile Silo Bunker, and prevents progress.

Log shows it as a write access violation. The previous lines for thread 43 show it unloading iccvid.dll and msvidc32.dll.

wine: Unhandled page fault on write access to 0x7d711000 at address 0x7bc45873 (thread 0043), starting debugger...

title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: Crashing resolved by adding "PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command%" to launch options, in-game radio no audio

title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: Start up launcher starts but the game itself doesn't. The launcher doesn't save data from previous attempts.

title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: HUD, NPC hair, drawn weapon, and night/day overlay vanishes from time to time, but comes back when the camera is moved. Can't type capital letters (i.e. player name). This is an issue with all games I've tested so far. Other than that, it plays very well.

title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: Crashes less frequently than Fallout 3, but still occasionally loses the HUD (and yellow world filter).  Things in the distance frequently blink black and white instead of their normal texture. Didn't do any tweaks, worked mostly out of the box.
